BR_text.BRsummary: Failing to load the blank Ukrainian model
BR_text.BRdescription:
Hi, when trying to initialize the Ukrainian blank model, the following error is raised.
 spacy-nightly is installed via pip install spacy-nightly, while I know how to fix this, I'm wondering is this a packaging issue?
 <denchmark-code>import spacy
 >>> spacy.blank('uk')
 
 Traceback (most recent call last):
   File "<pyshell#1>", line 1, in <module>
     spacy.blank('uk')
   File "D:\Python\lib\site-packages\spacy\__init__.py", line 26, in blank
     LangClass = util.get_lang_class(name)
   File "D:\Python\lib\site-packages\spacy\util.py", line 55, in get_lang_class
     module = importlib.import_module(".lang.%s" % lang, "spacy")
   File "D:\Python\lib\importlib\__init__.py", line 127, in import_module
     return _bootstrap._gcd_import(name[level:], package, level)
   File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 1006, in _gcd_import
   File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 983, in _find_and_load
   File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 967, in _find_and_load_unlocked
   File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 677, in _load_unlocked
   File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap_external>", line 728, in exec_module
   File "<frozen importlib._bootstrap>", line 219, in _call_with_frames_removed
   File "D:\Python\lib\site-packages\spacy\lang\uk\__init__.py", line 13, in <module>
     from .lemmatizer import UkrainianLemmatizer
   File "D:\Python\lib\site-packages\spacy\lang\uk\lemmatizer.py", line 18
     "The Ukrainian lemmatizer requires the pymorphy2 library and
                                                                ^
 SyntaxError: EOL while scanning string literal
 </denchmark-code>
 
 
 Operating System: Windows 10 64-bit
 Python Version Used: 3.7.2 64-bit
 spaCy Version Used: 2.1.0a9

comments_0.comment_text: Ugh, looks like this was a merge error that happened when syncing master with develop 😞 (And it's not caught by our default CI, because we can't easily test the languages with external dependencies, at least not on each build.) Fixing!

comments_1.comment_text: This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
